thread.title_full: Manchester United set to hand David De Gea ÂŁ300,000-a-week deal to reject Real Madrid

author: Sean Kearns
title: Manchester United set to hand David De Gea ÂŁ300,000-a-week deal to reject Real Madrid
text:
David De Gea is a target for Real Madrid (Picture: Getty) Manchester United will offer David De Gea a new deal to put him alongside the club’s top earners in a bid to persuade the Spaniard to reject Real Madrid.
Paul Pogba is currently the highest paid player at the Theatre of Dreams but the Red Devils are determined to keep hold of De Gea and will offer him a deal on par with the Frenchman.
Real Madrid have reignited their interest in the Spain international after seeing a move for De Gea collapse on deadline day in 2015.
The La Liga giants failed to submit the paperwork for De Gea’s move to the Bernabeu on time and he signed a new four-year deal at Old Trafford.
De Gea joined United from Atletico Madrid in a ÂŁ18.3m deal in 2011 (Picture: Getty) Despite having some time to remain on his existing deal, United are aware of the interest and believe a new deal could help persuade De Gea to turn down Madrid, according to the Sun.
Jose Mourinho’s side have been linked with moves forÂ Samir HandanovicÂ and Gianluigi Donnarumma but the Red Devils would rather hold on to De Gea, who joined the club in 2011 from Atletico Madrid.
